snippet: Two years after Bronx leaders helped defeat a plan to develop the Kingsbridge Armory into a retail mall, citing concerns over wages, they are supporting a new push by the Bloomberg administration.
abstract: Bronx leaders are supporting a push by the Bloomberg administration to develop the Kingsbridge Armory into commercial space, despite having rejected such a plan two years earlier; primary objection at the time was the refusal of the developer to agree to pay a 'living wage' to all employees of what would have been a shopping mall; now, Bronx Borough Pres Ruben Diaz Jr supports the plan, in light of a proposal before the New York CIty Council to impose a living wage requirement citywide on development that receive substantial subsidies.

byline.original: By KATE TAYLOR and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: Two years after Bronx leaders helped defeat a plan to develop the Kingsbridge Armory into a retail mall, citing concerns over wages, they are supporting a new push by the Bloomberg administration.

headline.seo: Kingsbridge Armory in Bronx Gets New Development Push
headline.main: As Wage Concerns Ebb, Bronx Armory Push Is Revived
headline.print_headline: As Wage Concerns Ebb, Bronx Armory Push Is Revived
